reviews.review_msg: As a bisc major - hand's down best bio prof at SFU. Yeah the lecture videos are long as hell but the flipped classroom method was the best kind of practice and motivation. He attended ALL Labs to see his students and stopped by all the desks to talk to us. Really funny and great at explaining ; also dense but helpful slides!

I heard about this course being tough but it is safe to say I was lucky to have Dr. Bains and Dr. Punja.  Dr. B taught most of the lectures and I found the flipped classroom method a huge help.  His practice questions during lecture were similar to the final exam.  Without this, I don't think I would have ended up with the grade I did.

Practice questions during lecture were super useful!  Student learning objectives helped big time for the midterm and final.  Also, enjoyed Dr. B.'s stories related to different human organ systems - especially the ones he had to deal with related to the circulatory system.  Finally, he is super approachable - always willing to answer questions.

Flipped classroom in lecture worked for me.  All the practice questions we went over helped big time for the short answer section of the final exam.  During the midterm and final exams, Dr. Bains came to the CAL office regularly to address any questions that I had.  He replied to my questions via email right away.  Thank you for being awesome.

I love having both Dr. Bains and Dr. Punja as Instructors this term.  Both have different teaching techniques, but my friends and I are enjoying them.  Dr. Bains is clearly passionate about biology and he provides plenty of practice questions for the midterm and final exam.  The online videos are informative (but may be a bit long at times).
Give misleading feedback. Not helpful at all.

Each lecture has an hour+ long pre-lecture that covers the material. All of the actual lecture is just working through practice questions. Pre-lecs are interesting, actual lecs are not. Lots of material on the exams. Claims he will only curve the final grades in our favour.

I took Bisc 101 and Bisc 202 with this professor and his lectures were amazing. He could explain the concept in detail. His exams were fair and some of them were straight memorizing. He is very caring and passionate about biology. He gives good feedback to students and tries to accommodate students' needs.

Quizzes and exams are very detail oriented and wordy, very easy to get confused with what his questions are asking. Always feels like I don't have enough time on exams. Lectures are good and make sense. Tutorials talked about subjects after the quiz on it though, wish the quizzes were delayed by another week so we can talk abtit in tutorial first

Taking it online during COVID time. He is a really great professor which tries to make things clear for everyone. His lecture is a bit long and they are all pre-recorded. Love his student learning objectives for every chapter which allows me to know which is his focuses in each of the chapters

Taking BISC 101 remotely, and this course is efficient and well organized. Dr. Bains (and the TAs) provide plenty of practice questions that are super helpful for the exams. Besides the lab component, there are 3 midterms that are not cumulative (each with bonus and CHOICE questions!). Textbook is optional. Highly recommend this prof to all.

Plenty of practice questions and practice sessions (plus!), choice questions on exams (plus!), takes students feedback seriously (plus!), very engaging and overall positive attitude (plus!), nice animations on PowerPoint lectures (plus!) - BISC 101 is a tough course with the content covered and labs, but Dr. B makes it easier to understand.
WORST INSTRUCTOR EVER! AVOID! YOU CANNOT GET GOOD GRADE DUE TO HIS WRONG TEACHING METHOD AND MALFUNCTIONED CANVAS SYSTEM + STUPID & EXPENSIVE PEARSON SYSTEM! AVOID FOR ALL COST!

Taken online during covid. He does a good job of communicating in and out of class. Does his best to make things visually interesting and lifts the mood. This course has a larger load but prof manages his lectures relatively well, and provides YT videos and optional textbook readings. All labs and tutorials are synchronous and labs require a mic.

Super friendly and everything is covered on his lecture slides. The slides are make with incredible detail and give you nearly all you need to know, however he does mention some extra key points during lectures so be sure to attend or listen to the recordings.

Had Onkar as a lab instructor, and he is exceptional at giving informative, easy to follow explanations. He makes the material engaging even for non-bio students. Would love to take a class with him as lecturer.

Onkar is a really good prof. I had him for bio 101 and he gives all the information you need in his slides. You have to go to lecture bc he uses fill in the blanks but lectures were v helpful anyways. Difficult in the sense that you had to know literally everything but you were set up to do very well as long as you put in the effort!

His lecture slides are very helpful as he alternates between fill in the blanks and ones that are already filled in, keeps you engaged in his lecture. Lectures are filmed and there are no iclicker questions. Very straight forward exams, complete and memorize his Student Learning Objective and you will 100% pass the class. Tutorials are mandatory
amazing prof! really cares about his students. His exam was hard. very smart man ! love him ! take bisc with him!!!

AMAZING PROF!! I had him for my first semester at SFU and his tests are hard (but fair), however, if you study the SLOs he gives you they are much easier. This class is an easy A if you put in the effort and study effectively. He is super knowledgeable and you can tell he loves what he does. He's also very realistic and humble. RECOMMEND!

Onkar is very enthusiastic, approachable, and a genuinely funny guy, which makes some of the more dull parts of biology, like plants, more bearable. He makes clear what is going to be on the test through his student learning objectives and everything you need to know is within his lecture notes, which makes an excellent study tool.

Dr. Onkar Bains is an incredible professor. If you have an option to take any course with him, I would definitely recommend doing so. You will have to study hard to have a good grade b/c exams will be reasonably complicated. My recommendation to future students - study slides CAREFULLY, he will ask really specific questions. Loves comparison ques.

Great professor, with awesome lectures that make the subject quite interesting. All of his exams were extremely fair with everything coming out of the notes and nothing unexpected. Expect to read a fair amount and know content in detail to get a good grade.

Awesome prof!Study his student learning objectives and you should be more than prepared for the exams. His notes are quite clear and easy to follow. Make sure to dedicate a significant amount of time reading.

so he is a good prof, I'm not gonna lie, but his exams are hard. And yes, there are student learning objectives and the exam is fair since it is out of the SLOs. However, if you wanna not have to work AS hard for your marks then don't take him because hes fair but he Makes you work for your grade. Too much info to review for the finals too.

Hands down, the best Instructor! Dr. B makes things clear in lecture, and at times he is hilarious. The sample questions given in lecture (along with the midterm and lab exam) were a big help, and I like the tips he gives to make learning concepts easier. The online Mastering assignments were fine since there was plenty of time to complete them.

was easy to understand and explained concepts clearly. had to buy a subscription to mastering and it wasn't cheap. mastering assignments were pretty rough b/c a lot of the time there were things we hadn't covered in the assignment, but often answers could be found in the textbook or online with some effort. labs were dull, but useful practice
The BEST prof ever! He makes his slides and student learning objectives straightforward. Also, if you pay attention in class he mentions what is likely to be on the exam.

most amazing prof i have had so far at SFU. not only are his lectures super interesting, he is a cool dude himself. he obvs cares about his students and his exams are very fair, just make sure u pay attention in labs as well as lectures and study for the lab exam ahead of time. follow the student learning objectives and ur gonna do really well!
Onkar was by far one of the best profs i have ever had at SFU,he made the lectures very interesting.
makes hard questions but will give you a lot of info

Best prof at SFU, HANDS DOWN. - He loves his job, knows his stuff! His lecture slides are SO DETAILED, throw out your textbook. If you care and have an interest in the course- EASY A. His midterm avg was 72% !! Not too stressed for the final! Hands down my favourite prof!!

Onkar is the best biology professor I've met. He covered quite some interesting topics aside from what the 101 curriculum had, and opted some of the boring-er stuff out. Study the student learning objectives and take note of what he says in lecture about what might come on exams, because they WILL be on there. Lots of hints; no surprises on exams.
Onkar  best instructor that I have ever had!  Thank you for all your help last term.  My friends and I really appreciate the effort you put in to helping us learn the material, especially the lab.

Onkar is the absolute best. He's extremely knowledgeable and does an excellent job of conveying that knowledge. He provided so many practice questions and prepared us really well for the lecture and lab final. He's a genuinely awesome person: funny, approachable, patient, helpful, and encouraging. I wish he taught all my classes.
Had him as a TA for BISC101, and I honestly wouldn't have gotten through it without him! He's awesome! So knowledgable, easy to approach and really wants students to succeed.

I have to say that out of all the profs that I have had at SFU, Dr. Bains ranks as one of the best.  During lecture, he lets you know the important things that will be examinable.  It also helps that he is approachable, funny and handsome (yeah I said it!)
Amazing prof, probably my favourite so far at SFU. Would definitely take more classes with him if time allows. Knows his stuff and helps students so makes studying SO much easier.
Amazing prof! Easy to talk to and actually cares about his students doing well. Wish I could take all my courses at SFU with him!

Loved this prof, very helpful and clear. Midterms and final were fair and grade earned depends on your effort. Second time taking this course and he taught the material very clearly. Always available for help. Very approachable. Take this class with him if you he's teaching that semester!

Dr. Bains was a super helpful prof who really made the material easy to understand and interesting. His midterm and lab exam was pretty intense with the amount of info that we had to know but his tests are fair and he lets you know in lecture the important things that he thinks you should know which show up on his exams. Highly recommend this prof
He was my TA and made everything so much easier to understand! I learned a lot in tutorial and his office hour. He also has a cute smile :)
Best TA ive ever had

To anyone who plans to take Bisc 101, make sure Dr. Bains is there in the lab!! After seeking his help, I was able to recover well following the first exam.  His words of encouragement really helped me get an A- in the course.  Overall, Dr. Bains definitely makes my Hall-of-Fame when it comes to teaching.

Onkar is one of the reasons why I was able to do awesome in the course.  I did not have  strong biology background, but after talking to him, I am thinking about pursuing Bio as a minor.  Very nice instructor, and yeah he is cute (one of the main reasons I attended the lab).

I gotta say that Dr. Bains is so cool!!!  He really helped my friends and I do well in the lab part of the course.  The lab final was more than fair but you must attend the labs to make sure you understand the results. Thanks again for putting up with the many questions we had.  Onkar = awesome

Dr. Bains is so patient and approachable.  No matter how silly the question was, he was willing to answer.  Thank you for all your help in the semester, even during the plants part of the lab course.  I hope that most profs are like him.

Even though Dr. Bains was only in labs during Tuesdays and Fridays, he was willing to answer my questions.  I didn't start off well in the course but after he gave me some good ways to study properly, I ended up with an A-.  Thank you so much!

One of the best teachers that I have ever had.  He was extremely patient with the many questions that I had about the course.  You do have to put in the effort to do well since there is a lot material to absorb.  He gave great tips on studying effectively, and so far it has worked.  On behalf of myself and my friends in BISC 101, you are da BOMB!
The coolest instructor that I have dealt with.  Thanks so much for all the help during the lab. HIGHLY recommended to any student who plans on taking first year Biology.

OMG! Onkar is amazing!  He helped me increase my confidence to do well in the course.  Super helpful! Super patient! Easy to talk to, and definitely willing to answer questions. I love his "go out there and kick ass" motto.

So far I agree with everyone that Onkar is all I want in a teacher.  He is patient, understanding, approachable, and funny.  In lab, Onkar does approach students to ask questions about the material being taught in order to see if we are doing our readings.  To the people who said he is handsome, I agree whole heartedly (very yummy indeed)

I enjoy how Dr. Bains uses the different concepts taught in BISC 101 to real life applications.  Finally, a professor who really wants ALL the students to do well and does not play favorites.  Also, he is so handsome (yes, I admit it!!!!)

Dr. Bains totally makes the lab worth attending.  He breaks difficult concepts down so that it's easier for first year students to understand (sorta like the human version of Coles notes for Biology 101..ha ha ha).  Also, the random questions that he asks during lab keeps students on their toes (which is a good thing!).  Need more profs like him.

Onkar is the best teacher I have ever had so far.  He is so patient and will make sure that you know the concepts STEP BY STEP!! As an arts student, I took BISC 101 as an elective.  Let's say my fear of science is now gone.  He's just so adorable!!!!!!!!
No Comments

Only taught the animal part of this class and was ill for several lectures so we had an instructor fill in for most of it. No real way to evaluate Kennedy, but from what I did see he was very keen on biology and had clean organized slides. Good sense of humour too.

He was barely present for his part of the course and when he was, he seemed bitter. I think he has the potential to be a good prof and maybe we were unfortunate to catch him at a bad time. I was really excited for animal biology and it was a huge disappointment. Difficult to know what to focus on. Final was all over the place. Not impressed.

Chris is a pretty awful instructor. His notes are bare bones and unorganized. He spends more class time on personal rants than teaching. His exam questions focus on weird, nit-picky details that test memorization not the ability to understand concepts.

Kennedy had amazing slides and organization.  He did't follow the textbook but then the exam was on his slides which he gives you anyway.  You can follow along with his slides in front of you.  He had clear examples of animals that showed AMAZING examples of physiology.  I'd take another course from his f'sure.
Super helpful outside of class. Gave me tons of study tips for the animal section.  Also going to do some volunteering in his lab in fall. Great prof!

Kennedy's lectures are extremely boring and his teaching style is a mess. His marking scheme for the final exam was insane; he asked the most irrelevant questions and completely neglected the topics he emphasized during class. However, if you read the notes, textbook, and do your own research, the exam is relatively easy.

TERRIBLE final. What I studied off his slides didn't appear on the exam. Had to know how a hawk moth regulates body temperature which is worth 10 marks (didn't answer that)! Slides - blegh. Exam questions: absolutely horrid. Expect GRAPHS and SUPER insignificant information to be thrown on there. Exam format is only short answer. Kennedy  pass.
Terrible. very confusing and boring. his exam is solely based on graphs and about 6 slides out of  200 something. worst prof and terrible exam.

Seems like a nice guy but once it came time to the exam I am immediately not a fan. The mark distribution on his questions was pretty ridiculous. All I can say is that he loves his graphs. Know those first. Very unclear as to what he wants from you until you get to the final and see it for yourself.

Great lectures and slides and a lot of amazing information about biology.  BUT don't ask this prof to help you -- he won't.  He only cares about his research and will humiliate you behind closed doors.  Unless he likes you (which is totally arbitrary), you are on your own.   This university is not about getting your money's worth.
Exciting professor.  Really enthusiastic. Obviously loves biology.
Always talks about going to his personal trainer...  At least once each lecture!
Great prof.  Liked the animal comparisons; why do animals survive crazy environments?  Graphs, bleh.

Was extremely unorganized, and was not very clear regarding what info you needed to study for the exam. He didn't explain his concepts very clearly, so you definitely need to become familiar with the textbook.
Chris Kennedy is a great prof. Read his slides and pay attention in his lectures and you're set for the final.
just go over his slides and read the text and do the question that he gives out as hw in class b/c they do appear in exams and also now the graphs..
I needed help and he spent over an hour going over stuff I had trouble with.  400 students in the class and he spends time if you need it.  Really really helpful
Nice guy. Good Prof. Something of an intellectual. His exams and lectures reflect that.

Super keen, interesting Professor in my opinion. Many thought he was too difficult, but I thought his lectures were advanced and at a level that engaged students. His powerpoints were organized. Great change from the overheads and writing used by the other lecturer. Exam was tough (know how to interpret graphs of bio data) but fair. EXCELLENT PROF!

Listen to the whiners! This guy loves his topic and teaches it like you are in University and not in high school. Punja spoonfeeds you, and Kennedy does not.  That is U life folks.  Great Prof. I'll take his upper division for sure.

Do the homework questions!!! You will be tested on at least 3 of them on the final. And when he says all you need are his notes, its true..... except he tests you on the tiniest detail that was barely mentioned in class so make sure you know ALL the slides. And he isn't lying when he says he likes diagrams/graphs.

Confusing, busy notes, not clear on his expectations. Repeats easy stuff and leaves you to figure out the hard stuff. Says his notes are enough for exams (plus homework) but not true.  You must read the text a lot -- and good luck on his crazy final. 10% of it was on something he talked for the last 30 seconds of final class. JERK doesn't care!
HORRIBLE! Might as well not attend his lectures. You'll learn more by staying at home and reading. He does not prepare you for the final AT ALL. Avoid him!
His slides in lectures aren't that useful. You have to read the book. The final was incredibly hard make sure you know the diagrams well).

Soo boring! I felt like he thought he was teaching 10 year olds rather than university students. He goes over the easiest concepts in too much detail and leaves the hard stuff for you to work out on your own. Lecture notes are busy, and so many diagrams...
know and understand any diagrams on his lecture slides. other than that, read the textbook and forget his notes.

He tried to have his notes with lecture be sufficient for his tests (and they were). His notes are extremely busy/poorly organized and hard to understand. Attending class is a must to try and get it. He seems to be unreceptive to questions in class and seems not to want to meet outside of class. Overall kudos for trying to improve your teaching!

Make sure you do his homework. He tells you you'll be tested on it, and YOU WILL BE. Also make sure you listen to all the fish stuff, because he loves fish. I liked that he makes you think about answers instead of blind regurgitation, but make sure you know your stuff intensely. Correlate it all with the textbook.

Great Prof!!! I loved the presentation of his lecture notes! Very clear in his explanation of concepts and just all around interesting lectures! The Final was difficult, but really fair if you just did the homework and listened in class...
He cant teach. No spoon-feeding notes. His notes are messy and disorganized! But he is a Nice guy tho. Take BISC101 with Punja!!! Punja can teach but Kennedy can;t!

Definately not good as Punja. I'm not saying that he sucks but his notes aren't that clear and his final exam is kind of difficult. If you are planning to take the course with him, just REMEMBER when he tells you to do something for homework...DO IT!! and know it IN DETAIL cause it's going to be tested on the final exam for sure!!
Not as good as Punja but good nonetheless. Concepts are supplemented by diagrams. Doesn't write everything you need to know, so you should read the text, also.

Different teaching style from Punja. He makes you think more and scramble through other sets of notes (lab notes) and text. But Bisc 101 comes as a package of Punja and him so can't really avoid. To fully comprehend notes, attend lecture for details since he doesn't write down everything. Nice guy otherwise.
Wow. He is one of the best profs I have had. My only criticism is that he writes notes rather quickly, and they are sometimes messy.

His lectures are boring and he does not teach you what is important.  You are best reading the textbook. His exam is unfair, the whole exam was basically unrelated material he puts at the end of his lectures. However, you can tell that he loves his subject.  He just can't teach it.

hes some what boring and his notes are so useless. his exam is ridiculous- too many marks for a simple question! overall he was so boring made me want to never go to his class. our exam consisted of questions that almost had nothing to do with the course--him and his "focus" at the end of class pfft
Good professor, very passionate about what he teaches
cool class
his notes rn't the best. he skips over alot of the stuff n u hav to read the text for some major concepts. he's nice n layed back though.
Very good
No Comments
No more fish...or arrows in the notes!
Notes are unclear and unorganized!
boring! always used fish as examples - nothing else!
sucks!  notes are unclear!
Not sufficient lecture notes, doensn't explain the contents clearly.
No Comments

Class Average for final was a 49%, if you were wondering if you should take this class take it with someone else. He has a bunch of unnecessary tasks throughout the course like a forest diary and a forest walk uncorrelated with the course content. Ron was extremely rude when I saw him in office hours despite nagging us to come for help. AVOID !!!

Dude is the most unprofessional prof I've ever met, not only do his lecture slides not have words on it... he posts the most random questions completely unrelated to biology in our exams... How is anyone even supposed to know that. Overall he was a lazy guy who should just retire now instead of suffocating more students.
Ron is a great professor. He's interested in the material, he's clear, and he's very helpful!
Really bad prof.

DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. I did not listen to people when they said don't take it but I wish I listened. Her test were not related to the material and VERY DIFFICULT. Each lecture had 70+ slides. She gives test study guides but the tests are the exact opposite. Lab final was difficult as well. Try as hard as you want but that A will never be seen.

ivona was really engaging. there were in class quizzes which made attendance mandatory. also weekly at home quizzes that forced' you to review the material each week. TAs were really helpful, please talk to them if u need (ivona was also extremely approachable). labs weren't mandatory attendance but i recommend going to strength ur understanding.
For all first years I would say avoid this prof and instead of taking this class at the Surrey Campus do yourselves a favour and take it in Burnaby.

Very friendly and approachable to questions/feedback. Lectures are content heavy in the span of 50min. but if you review and catch up its not too difficult. She also has handouts that sum up her lectures, self tests after each unit for practice and the textbook for extra help. Tests are fair and the lab exam is easy if you do the work
Lectures are not interesting. Very boring. Lectures are useless, you have to go home and teach yourself. Tests are awful and time consuming.

"Dr. M" is a great professor. She really cares about her students' wellbeing and understanding of the course material. If you ever have a question/concern, go to her and she will help you resolve it. She takes feedback often. Beware: if you don't do the readings/practice she recommends, you won't do well because not everything is covered in class.

She makes lectures a bit more fun and engaging, has good TA's. Cares about her students, components of the course makes it easier to boost up your grade. Tests and lecture quizzes are quite difficult though.

Ivona is a caring professor. Her lectures are packed with content, but her Weekly Handouts and Weekly Worksheets r great practice so try completing them weekly. Midterm was easy and the Lecture Final was pretty difficult, she never posts any averages on Canvas with your grades so ask her personally to gauge how your doing in the class.

Ivona is super caring and wants to see her students succeed. Her midterm and final are solely based on the lecture slides. If you memorize the lecture slides then you will do well on the midterm and final.

Ivona is a very sweet lady, but she is VERY tough when it comes to assignments and tests. You must understand every concept she teaches (only her way is correct) in order to pass the course. You have to work hard to get a good grade. Also, the class is curved so beware!!!

You have to be very specific with your wordings when it comes to exams. Some of her slides are worded strangely, however, she does gives good explanations during her lectures. The practice midterms are helpful!

Ivona knows her stuff but her lectures are super content-heavy and they can be difficult to sit through. Although, if you don't go to lectures you would probably be fine since all the slides are posted. Her exams were worded strangely and if your answers are not word for word, even if using synonyms you will probably not get the marks.
Two words: GPA KILLER

she's a very sweet and caring person, and would make sure that everyone understood the material. her lectures and the way she taught the course was very organized and if you missed something in lecture she has all the info on the slides posted on canvas. noticed that she's also a very tough marker. when writing exams/quizzes you MUST be specific!!!

Explanations arent very clear. Office hours were not helpful. Wording of exam questions can be very tricky/confusing and answers are very specific (any synonyms to the answer are incorrect) When studying and you see something that you think might not be on an exam, STUDY IT because I guarantee it WILL be tested. Study each and every single slide.

Tests and quizzes are based off of her notes. However, the notes are very poorly written and do not provide meaningful understanding of the material. Not to mention, they are terribly organized and are riddled with grammatical and formatting mistakes. Unclear in lecture and does not understand the material herself; the TAs are basically guide her.

Such a caring prof! Take advantage of her office hours!! Gives lots of advice on studying & preparing for quizzes, midterms and finals. Everything you need to know are on the lecture slides, including what kind of questions will be asked on the tests. She is present in labs and very involved with students personal learning. VERRRYYY GOOOODDDDDDDDD!
Shes really nice and cares about your learning.

Definitely one of the most kind and caring profs out there. She always asks for student feedback on how she can improve and does her best to help aid her students. Lectures can be a bit boring and labs are usually rushed, but overall the course is interesting. At the end of each lecture it is made clear what will be tested on the midterm and final.

Lectures were boring.  However, she is very kind and cares about her students; she's constantly trying to improve her teaching methods.  Midterm and final lecture exams were straight-forward.  The lab final exam was tricky and you must pass it to pass the entire course itself.  Help is always available.  Overall, heavy course load but easy tests.

There's a lot of help available. You just have to keep up with the course load and as long as you understand the material well you will do good.  She is a really caring prof and along with the TA's they genuinely want you to succeed. The only downer are labs which are confusing  and the lab exam which is unfortunately a big chunk of your mark.

Dreadful. Absolute dreadful. She told us to buy a lecture manual with fill-in-the-blanks to take notes in but her slides do not match up with it at all. She has a thick accent and does not explain things thoroughly or well at all, then moves on to the next topic quickly. Her labs are unorganized and she is less than helpful. Avoid at all costs.
NOT a good prof.

Excellent prof, absolutely loved her. She made classes really interesting and split up the marks in a fair way (ex. finals and midterms weren't worth too much on their own). Would definitely recommend getting her workbook if you can for the lectures and to go to every lab as while they aren't mandatory the lab exams are very hard and easy to fail.

Overall, good prof. However, she's not always clear in lecture, and it's hard to listen and try to take notes in the workbook. The exams aren't too bad if you study hard for them, even though a lot of material is covered in the course. Attending tutorials definitely helped and ask her questions during office hours or by email.

She's a really nice prof, not intimidating at all. The midterm and final were okay. If you want a really good grade be prepared to work for it. The only thing I didn't like about the course was her lack of help. When people asked questions during lecture or during the lab she wouldn't  really answer the question asked.
STAY AWAY. You will FAIL her course because she will expect you to know EVERY DETAIL from the textbook. If you are willing to recite a 300 page textbook then this course is right for you.

Compared to the other bio 101 prof, she was AMAZING. As long as you listen in class and keep up with the readings, her exams are fair. She's really enthusiastic about the material and tries to keep it interesting with videos and diagrams. Even though we have to pay $40 for her lecture book, the review slides at the  end of every lecture really help

Dr. M is very knowledgeable in her field of teaching however, she goes through lectures topics really fast without giving student enough time to write down notes before she starts talking about the next topic and results in needing to consult the textbook from time-to-time. Nevertheless, she does make classes interesting and enjoyable.

Her lectures are extremely boring and not mandatory. u can teach yourself with the text I would recommend taking this teacher over any other because her assignments are REALLY easy, and her exams are fairly easy if you study beforehand and know your stuff.
No help in labs. Hardly ever present in lab and even then was less than helpful. Luckily, TAs were good.

Decent prof.  Her assignments were easy, but a complete waste of time.  Her tests were fair, but there were a ton of multiple choice.  I had a great TA, so that probably made the difference.  A lot of textbook reading which is a must since there are questions from there on the exams.  I hear she's the easier of the two BISC 101 profs.

her lectures are well organized and her notes are very detailed. She even has review sections in her notes to make sure you understand what's going on. PLUS...at the end of each lecture she tells you what stuff is most important to concentrate on. definitely recommend doing the readings

thought she was a great prof. sure, she has a bit of an accent and had trouble with her mic, but that wasn't her fault. You do have to read one chapter per lecture, but what did you expect? She has a few easy assignments that account for a decent amount of marks and she has decent exams, although you have got to be pretty specific with your wording

She's NOT a good prof.For each lecture,you have to read an ENTIRE chapter so in the end you're left with 20 chapters to study for the final.Her lectures are VERY boring and the final exam and the lab exams are HARD. She basically tells you to read the whole text and it makes me wonder what is a prof for?

Had her a while ago. Didn't enjoy going to lectures at all. and she was very hard to understand NOT because of her accent, but because of her MIC! Exams were ok though, she was kind enough to scale because our class average for the final was very low!

Very hard to understand, very soft speaker (even with microphone), enthusiastic, likes details on midterm. Only had her for first half of class, fair midterm. Going to lectures only useful for filling in blanks on slides. Pay attention to last slides about what's important to know for midterm.

She's terrible with technology. She spends atleast 10 minutes of lecture trying to get her mic to work. She speaks way too fast to complete notes. Her homework assignments are sometimes really unclear. Don't bother trying to email her with concerns. She'll just tell you to talk to the TAs.
Does not go into details and not comprehensible sometimes.
Final exam was tricky. Content was extensive ~ 100 pages /week + ~20 pages/week for lab. Yay. Get cracking on the textbook right now!
attendance sooo not mandatory! boring class!

i completely agree that being in lectures does not help much to understand the course material, but i also do not blame her, its not her fault bio is so boring. I guess it all depends on your level of interest before going to class, and mine is absolutely none, i give her credit for trying to make it as fun as possible but i mean its bio...

Lectures are so boring. Always 20 mins of technical difficulties and mic problems at the start of the lecture which are "not her fault" yet mysteriously doesn't happen with any other prof I have. No charisma or enthusiasm whatsoever.. seems to read all of her lecture notes from a pre-written script. Better of just studying from the book :(

Let me just say that attendance to her class is NOT mandatory, at all! I don't understand anything she is saying because she doesn't get her mic fixed! her mic is old or something! So I pretty much go over the entire lecture on my own everyday with the guide of the textbook which is like the size of my house, something that cant be carried 2 school
the labs are pretty clear and she helps a lot.

She relies solely on the textbook, so you might as well just buy it and read it instead of taking the class. She does not record her lectures, so if you miss anything, too bad for you! I loved biology before I took this class; now, i could care less about how plants and animals work.

We got behind in the lectures at the very beginning of the semester so she had to rush through the slides far to fast to write anything. Fortunately all the notes are online. All the information she gives is in the textbook but the midterm was fairly easy if you read the textbook. Seems nice, doesn't get mad when Superman crashes a lecture!

Speaks very fast during lectures, and rushes through power point slides at an unbelievable rate.  Presents a lot of information, but does not distinguish between relevant and irrelevant.  I start toning out after about 30 min.  Hope that you get a good TA, because Mladenovic's explanations are more confusing than enlightening.
Well i love biology but i am sorry i dont want to be rude but i dont find that the ways she teaches i learn alot.
lectures are ok, topic is boring. she's knowledgeable and always answers my questions over email at any time.
she talks to fast, you cant understand her and all she does is read her notes off. no extra information, therefore no reason to attend lecture at all!!

She claims her tests are fair but it's not, you need to do 60 questions (which is mc and written) under an hour, the ta's for that class also pmo, tutorials are useless, her grammer is so bad u don't understand the questions on the test, the slides are useless its all pictures, lectures are basically pointless, don't take the class with her

Tests are ridiculous, 50 MC along with 36 points worth of long answers. The test is to be completed in 50 minutes. Do not take this class with her if you can help it. During lectures Megan fails to teach properly. Megan is late and untidy nearly everyday.

her tests are way too long for a fifty minute period. it takes her 10 minutes to get everyone settled and hand out the test and then she yaps for another five minutes. the multiple choice questions are worded so weirdly and the grammar is off on so many questions. you'd think that since she's white her grammar would be better, but it's not.

Cannot teach, she does this feedback about the course thing every week where we spend 30 minutes on it, and yet she doesn't even take the feedbacks seriously, you're gonna be so confused in class if you dont read 20+ pages she assigns due next day. Don't get me started with pre class quizzes. Don't take the class with her

she cannot teach so she makes us read like over thirty pages of notes every single class. class time is wasted by her saying talk to your partner like can you just teach us something?? and don't even get me started on the iclickers. they are so useless, they don't help at all but you need to show up or you don't get the marks. dont take her class

Hi all, 

I'd say to you don't take this class. She is a very difficult prof to deal with. She says one thing and brings another in exam. The slides are just pictures not helpful. Does not explain well. Only a lot of participation. Don't take with her.

First of all, do not take this course with her if you are not ready to read. I taught myself 95% of this course, by reading the textbook and doing practice questions. Lectures were useless and I only attended to get my iClicker marks. Megan cannot teach, class time was wasted on clickers and "discuss with the person beside you."
Cant teach so she tells everyone to read the whole textbook. Lectures are pointless but theres Iclicker. She always talks about how she prioritizes teaching but the class average is a C+

Energetic and uses lecture time well, focus is placed more on building on the readings than retreading them. She provides a lot of study material to prepare for tests and lectures and is refreshingly transparent about what's going on behind the scenes. There are boring points in the course itself but that's more on the material than her.

Megan is a nice prof, caring, and really likes feedback so she can improve her teaching. However the course content itself doesn't really match with the lectures going on in BISC 101 lecture. I had her for the lab portion and she was nice but the lab exam was rushed as hell. 8 questions with like 4 parts was legit death. content is easy

Dr. Megan is an awesome professor. She really cares about her students and is really easy going. The labs are not too complicated. She tells fun stories at the beginning of the class. Overall a really nice person and an awesome professor.
Dr. Barker was the most interesting professor I have had so far, she cares about her students and is passionate about biology. I wish I had her for more classes.

She's amazing, caring and kind. Her labs help explain the course material and she gave the option for bonus marks rather than betting everything on the final exam. The homework isn't so bad, seeing how you have a week to do it. Then during class time, you get to work on an extension of the lab with your group. She explains things well.

Megan was my lab instructor for BISC101. Overall, she made the course way more fun and interesting and her "pre-lab talks" were very nice. I could tell she cared for us and our wellbeing, especially given how weird everything is online. The lab portion of the course was alright... Not my favourite, but it wasn't bad either! Megan was awesome :)

Megan was the lab coordinator for the class, so I didn't see/hear much from her that semester but any videos I did see of her she was super friendly. Some lab preps were a tad difficult so I strongly suggest starting on them the day of or day after they come out. The labs were more relaxed, and TAs were more than willing to help out.
Really nice, you can tell she cares. Helpful pre-lab discussions, labs not too hard. My favourite prof this term.

Dr. Barker is an amazing professor! She tries to engage with students and is always really enthusiastic. She gives two optional projects that can help bump up your grade which shows that she really cares about her students. The pre labs are a bit long sometimes but the labs are fine. Overall, totally recommend taking a class with Dr. Barker!

Megan is sweet, caring and willing to adapt. She can be disorganized at times, but she's very open for comments and feedbacks, tho sometimes a little slow. Explains concepts very thoroughly and wants to make sure that everyone is on the same page. Inspires us to love Biology the way she does. Definitely one of the best profs I've ever had. Jolie

Megan is very kind and approachable, but she just wasn't very good at her job. Started semester off with a very different syllabus than at the end. Takes FOREVER to get any sort of feedback whatsoever. Most learning is done in lengthy textbook readings, lectures don't go into very much detail. The course was stressful due to disorganization.

This is a class that makes you work for it. If you put in the work you will see results & one of the plus points of Megan is that she doesnt let your marks only be affected by the tests (theyre spread out). This class has its downsides but if you work hard you can end strong! Read the textbook!!! Memorize it if you have to!

Took this class in summer online. Awful experience, do not take it with her. Notes + lectures  useless. Need to memorize textbook and self teach if you expect a decent grade. She gave the hardest practice exam and exam questions (when I searched up a few practice answers, they were recycled from previous UBC second and third year bio courses).

This was a pretty standard class considering you had to work hard for your grade. You really need to know the material to do good on the tests and I recommend basing your studying off the textbook mainly. Other than that, the only annoying thing was the lab preps/post labs were way too long and midterms/assignments take forever to get graded.

Megan is super funny, her lectures are engaging! But if you are an introvert this may not be the professor to take this class with. Every lecture you are forced to "discuss with people around you" and do group worksheets. The midterm and final both had "group" components too. But Megan is really great at explaining concepts and is a good prof!

Megan is so so kind and very willing to answer any questions you may have. She's a new prof so she still understands the struggles students face. Her lectures are fun and connect well with the lab portion of the course. Her tests are very fare and she has multiple avenues to receive feedback from students so she knows what to focus on in lecture.

If Erin Barley is teaching BISC 101 then take her instead!! She was way better than Megan!! Megan has harder tests and sometimes more complex "apply your thinking" questions, and Erin has straightforward easy ones!! First midterm for Megan I got 53% and for Erins i got 73%!!!! Take Erin instead!

Megan is a great prof. She pays attention to detail in the course structure and is open to student engagement and suggestions. The targeted reading guides she gives are very helpful and save time when preparing for class. She's funny and tries her best to make lectures fun. She is very enthusiastic when teaching.
Super nice and engaging. Teaches the material well in a way that makes you remember and understand it. Tests and marking was fair.

Super nice prof and decent course (101) if you do all the readings and take notes. Lectures aren't super helpful but you get clicker marks so... Barker is really accessible outside of class too, and very easy to chat with and clarify knowledge. She appreciates when students clearly put work in before coming to see her, and will be more helpful
Did not explain things in detail

Amazing prof who cares a LOT. Tests are relatively tough. A lot of independent studying, but she's always ready to help and spend however much time you need to help clarify and answer questions. If you take advantage of her office hours, you will find the course very enjoyable and easy to get through. If you don't, you might find it quiet hard.

Course is tailored for students who thrive on independent study. Exams are quite difficult and require lots of attention to detail. The course is definitely manageable but you need to put work in extra effort as she doesn't cover everything in lecture. Super cool and funny person though, really cares about her students and is very engaging.

Super helpful and personable!! Makes the lectures engaging and fun, not too serious and helps you really understand the material. Midterms and exams are quite detailed and challenging though, lot's of hypothetical thinking
Amazing Prof. that actually care about student's opinion. Her lecturers are straight forwarded and easy to understand.

One of my fave profs. Her lectures are engaging, and she only focuses on the material students find difficult (we filled out a feedback quiz each week). Although she's super nice, I had to work very hard for an A. Pre-class readings are definitely mandatory with megan, and exams were fairly difficult. But, if you put in the work you should be fine.

Last comment, if you want to do well in this class, read my past comments 08/16, ignore the whiny students who did poor because of their lack of effort, finding ways to get back at this amazing prof.  I will tell you right now the only thing close to being 'unfair' is the amount of time given for the Final lecture exam, it was just awfully long.

For the guy commenting on Botox pillar, that was only an example around a concept you ALREADY learned in class, it had nothing to needing outside class material to answer the question.  For the guy commenting on having to read the book, get real, this is a university level course, you expect people to hold your hands all the time?

THE MOST CARING AND LOVING BIOLOGY PROFESSOR IN THE WHOLE WIDE WORLD. I LIKED HER SO MUCH, I SOMETIME WISH SHE WAS MY MOM SO I CAN HAVE QUALITY DISCUSSION ABOUT THE WORLD WITH HER BECAUSE SHE KNOWS SO MUCH ABOUT EVERYTHING. ON TOP OF THAT SHE'S STILL STUDYING DESPITE HAVE HER MASTER. BEST WISHES ON YOUR NEWBORN MEGAN, THANK YOU FOR EVERYTHING!

I already commented, but here are study tips: -Do pre-reading one week in advance for the online quiz -Take lecture notes in class -Review textbook notes + lecture notes at end of every week -Do all practice exams (THIS IS CRUCIAL) -Ask TAs for help + attend office for free answers to practice exam -Do pre- AND in-lab activities BEFORE lab

I knew NOTHING coming into this course. A lot of first year students were crying about exams being unfair, and for me this is NOT TRUE! If I came out on top knowing nothing to start, why can't you? Do not expect to be babied in this course like most first year courses, you HAVE TO READ, you HAVE TO DO EXTRA RESEARCH.  MEGAN IS ABSOLUTELY AMAZING!!

I've been at SFU for 5 years and I can definitely say Megan is an AMAZING professor. The course is well structure in terms of course layout and study method, if you don't work hard, you will NOT do well. This means pre-read all the readings a week ahead, and do extra research on the side. It's also EXTREMELY important to do all her practice exams.

her exams are not related to what you read and learn. One of the shocking questions is that she was asking about Botox pillar treatment when I learned Digestion, Respiration/Circulation, Neurons and Signals, Muscles. Might be related concepts but for me, it doesn't make any sense to ask that to freshman students. We are not doctors.

This is one of those profs that makes you work your ass off for a good grade, but cares so much about her subject and inspires you to love Biology. Her lectures have group discussions and activities and are the most engaging I've had at SFU so far. She focuses a lot on her teaching methods, and it shows. Difficult course, but so worth it.

Megan was the highlight of my First semester at SFU. She expected you to do the pre readings and have a grasp of the concepts before coming to lecture, and she went over the basis of everything you needed to know. Her tests were fair, maybe a little long but very, very similar to her practice exams. Get ready to read, but you need to go to lectures

This course is based off of you doing the prereadings, and if not you are screwed for exams because you can't study off her lecture slides as they are just pictures! Bio with her is a self taught course. Nobody has time to study the lengthy and useless readings, recommended. She does not believe in curving (heads up). I had to retake the course!

She is so awesome. Scaled the final exam (over 100% was awarded to multiple students) Many questions on the final were minor variations on her practice exams. She's awesome, take her course, work hard, keep on top of your readings. She can't upload her brain onto yours, stop blaming her when you can't answer her questions - they are fair.

Amazing prof! She was one of my favourite profs at SFU and after taking her BISC 101 class, all the other profs pale in comparison. She puts lots of effort into her slides, students, and activities. Time flew by in her lectures! But beware, you will have to work to get a good grade.

Don't take this class with her. Her lectures are so boring she makes you do group work in the lectures and it usually doesn't make sense. Get ready to read. The midterms/final is different from what you are taught so get ready to pull allnighters. This course is way to heavy to be a first year course.

Both midterms and final exam were fair if you studied the textbook in depth (read the things she says to skip lol). Some exam questions have a ridiculous amount of jargon that could be cut down to make the question more clear. Kind professor, but pushes group activities to the point of irritation. One lecture, she only got through 1 slide. :/
Amazing prof! Easy A if you study well for midterms and final! Very fair tests! Provides lots of office hours for extra help if needed!

Very passionate prof, and clearly knows the material and loves to teach others about biology; covers a lot of material in lecture & a lot of reading for pre-class quizzes.  Tests are very long but fair - know your stuff really well so that you can complete the entire test.

She is very enthusiastic and passionate about biology,  I honestly really enjoyed attending her lectures, even tho she does not cover a lot of difficult concepts during lectures . But her tests are hard you have to memorize EVERYTHING and be fast at reading and answering questions. She puts a lot of effort into teaching.
Avoid. Wastes time.  Tests are not fair. I don't want to take any more biology classes thanks to her.

expects to complete exams with a minute for each question even tho majority voiced that it wasnt reasonable for us, she didnt take our suggestion and kept exams lengthy and material on exams was unexpected compared to what we covered in lecture.

I strongly disagree with the many people saying that Megan's expectations were unclear. I wish that all of my professors cared enough to make detailed reading outlines that explicitly state what to skip and what is fair game for testing. Megan is an exceptional instructor who goes above and beyond but demands her students work at hard as she does.

Her exams were challenging but fair, really makes you work for a good grade, but the averages were pretty normal for first year science courses. She gives lots of office hour times before exams and is very approachable. Her lectures were decent and her enthusiasm for the course material made the class enjoyable.

Her passion and enthusiasm is amazing in all of her lectures. She knows how to engage the class and always looks for feedback on her teaching. She gives good summaries in lectures but her exams require work on your own to grasp the details. She gives very good support though.

She's a very nice person, and easy to talk but.. but she can't teach  very well. Her lectures are based on the easier / easiest concepts, and she doesn't spend any time time on the material she tests you on.. Which leads me to say her tests don't make sense more than half the time. Don't waste your time with her class, save your GPA

Megan is one of the best profs i have ever had! She is enthusiastic and clearly explains all concepts we cover in class. Some people expect to be able to just show up to class and get an easy A, Thats not the case. The pre readings are necessary as they teach you the basic concepts that she continues on. Tests are long but similar to the practice.

On the exams I found myself reading these paragraph long questions with so much malarkey, only to realize I  just spent 5 minutes reading a multiple choice question. Lectures were simple, briefly explaining a few concepts out of many from the entire chapter. Exams are brutal, average is about 50-60%. No curving/scaling of grades. GL you'll need it.

Exams are very wordy and you usually run out of time for them. Pre-reading is mandatory but prof goes over concepts in class anyways. Doesn't cover material similar to tests, only teaches the basics so be ready to go searching for other study material.
very long exams, not quite helpful lectures.

Loved her as  a person, not so much as a prof. She spent a lot of time trying to inspire her class to study and work in groups, as well as discussions outside of bio rather than the actual material. She was extremely accessible though, lots of hours and although her tests were a little wordy, they were pretty fair.

Exams are very wordy and long so you would run out of time often. Lectures are very general while exams are very specific which is not helpful. Workload is heavy and need to review often to not fall behind. Tries to make class entertaining but wastes time and not helpful in long run. Must study extra to do well in class. Long readings + quizzes.

Dr. Barker spent enormous amounts of lecture needlessly interacting with the crowd. The small amount of time left over barely allowed us to advance past the simple concepts from the pre-reading, and into difficult exam type examples. For a student to be successful in this course, a large amount of time must be spent seeking other learning sources.

Take a different section if you can.  Wastes time in lectures on simple topics, just tries to do too much to make biology cool. The wording on pre-reading q's is often misleading, and whether you've done the reading or not won't matter because she will quiz on abstract stuff , but then spend the whole lecture talking about the easy stuff.

Megan spends too much time thinking about how she will look cool to the students then actually caring if she does well.  Her exams are too long, with questions bogged down by useless words and she spends a lot of time in lectures wasting time about the little things, but quizzing the most obscure details in the reading for that week.  AVOID

Megan is an amazing prof! Being a first year, I found the workload quite heavy and hard to keep up with, but it definitely pays off if you do.  Lots of iclickers and group worksheets, which make the lectures more engaging.  Midterms are tough but fair and very similar to the practice questions that she gives.

Megan takes lectures not as a opportunity to build on the specifics from the prereading we were assigned, but to revisit 1-2 simple concepts. Often times you will find yourself going 50 min without writing anything bc she doesnt present anything above a bio 12 level There is a huge misalignment between test material and what is presented in lecture

Her lectures are amazing and really well prepared. Class work is engaging and she works well with the lab instructors and TAs. Megan's passion for biology shines each lecture and she makes you really get into proteins (her favourite haha). Very approachable! Exams are hard, as to be expected in a bio course, but be prepared and you'll be fine.

Such an inspiration for women into STEM and super passionate about biology & biochemistry. I'm an arts student but she's making me think of switching to science! Be prepared (do ALL the pre-reading and practice q's) and don't be shy to talk to her and ask questions, & you will succeed. She's very approachable and has the geekiest/nerdiest humor.

This professor gives amazing lectures and she is clearly very passionate about biology, however, I would switch professors if I could.  If someone does all the required pre-readings, takes notes from the txts and goes to lectures they should get a good grade.  NOT.  The pre-reading  q's and m/c midterm q's were confusing, and midterm was too long!
Super approachable and explains things very clearly. Provides a lot of material to practice and encourages asking questions. He has engaging lectures and prepares you to succeed and learn optimally.
Very good prof. Cares and gives great advice on navigating life as a student.
Amazing. He's the best biology professor!!

he geniunely does everything right. LOOK at his PEqs and learn how he likes things answered(hes so fair in marking). he is so kind when responding to emails. only thing i will say is his slideshows are a bit of a mess and theres too much info and pictures that are distracting. but overall i could tell he wants the best for the students!!
the goat of biology, kevin explains well and prepares you well for exams

What a great professor. He is very good at explaining things using beautiful and very detailed slides. He also gives his students practice exam questions before the real exam and gives feedback on the student's answers to the question. He also gives us bonus marks for participation quizzes.

all profs should model their teaching after Kevin! he mad eme want to do well even if I didn't understand the material well, and he made himself extremely accessible outside of class! he was extremely encouraging and kind to all students and I've never had a prof who's cared as much as he does

Kevin is awesome! He gave us many different ways to contact him outside of class, including office hours, phone numbers and emails. The course has a lot of content, but he explained every concept fully and was very clear about what he expected from us on exams. He posted lots of study resources, notes, and practice questions.

He really wants his students to do well. He provides practice exam questions for each unit, and posts an answer key on how he would want you to answer. The only issue is i find his slides too messy and overloaded with paragraphs. His midterm was difficult but fair. He provided personal phone number and would give us advice on how to do well.
THE GOAT

Literally the best lecture notes I had ever seen. You don't have to take notes and just focus on listening. Video lectures are also of good quality. Very caring and accessible. Graded only by one midterm and final (in lecture portion) so no homework except bonus quizzes, which are based on participation. Literally by ideal prof.
Not sure how it's possible to get rated a 5.1/5 on RMP but he deserves it.

Super caring and his lectures are very well structured and helpful. During the semester a student reached out to him saying how difficult this semester has been for them and Kevin sent out a 2000 word email to the entire class saying "you matter don't worry you can get through this". Amazing prof who genuinely cares about his students well being.

Kevin is a really amazing professor. Midterm was not too hard, the final required using a lot more detailed thinking than he went into in lectures. His section vs plants for the final (diff prof) was ABSURD the difference in difficulty, his being way more critical and complicated, which could be good or bad depending on how you look at it.

Kevin is by far my favorite professor. He is very caring and it's very obvious that he has his students' best interest in mind. I love the way he teaches and his office hours are really useful for anything you need clarification on. The class itself was a bit challenging as the exam questions are more application based unlike most classes.

He's one of the most caring and amazing prof I've ever met. He always engages you in the lectures and makes every concept sound so simple. His exams are relatively straightforward. He also gives practice exam questions which are super hard but dont stress too much, he doesnt make his exams that difficult. Highly recommend his class!!!
Super caring and when the class went online for covid, he was a legend.

Not bad but not incredible. He gives super detailed lecture slides and some of it doesn't appear on tests. I don't know why I bothered to go to his lectures, the notes were all given online. He seems really into teaching though and excited about biology, and he is really kind and caring about his students.

Had him as a lab instructor, wish I could have this man in every moment of my life. Seriously go out of your way to take any class he is teaching. He was always willing to help even at short notice and got me to understand a bunch of the lecture material. His lab exam/quizzes are some of the most fair tests I've ever written. Great man, great class
10/10 would recommend

Kevin is my lab instructor this semester and he is incredibly kind. You can tell that he genuinely wants his students to succeed. I was surprised when he actually managed to remember all of his students' names within several days. I hear he is a prof as well and I expect he's just as good as a prof as he is a lab instructor. PHOT vids were amazing!

Kevin was only my lab instructor but honestly what a guy. I really appreciate how he focuses on the understanding of content rather than memorizing facts because this really helps in the long run. The labs for this class has no where near the amount of detail as the lectures, but it really puts content into perspective. Quality over quantity! :)

Kevin Lam was my lab supervisor and was incredibly helpful during my tough first semester taking BISC101. He is very kind and patient with questions so do not hesitate! He even makes youtube videos to help students understand difficult concepts! He really cares if students understand content, and as a guy, I still have to say that he's hot O_O
Best Lab Instructor ever. Super passionate and is willing to help and explain whenever you need. Highly recommended.

Kevin is AMAZING. Yes, he's kinda new... But he genuinely cares about each and every student. Puts the effort in to memorize names, and is always willing to help. Lab was a bit difficult bc very little time, but he was very considerate and didn't take anything in for marks when we were rushed. Would defs recommend him for any bio course/lab. Cute.

One of the most helpful people I have met. He asks you questions that use your own knowledge to get the answer out of you, Pleasure learning from him and looking forward to taking more classes with him.
Kevin is the best! He's approachable and teaches concepts really well. He could always clear things up that I didn't understand in the lecture. His labs are a pleasure to attend.
Dr. Lam is very patient and understanding whenever I approached him with questions.  He does make you think, which I know will better prepare me for the higher division courses.  Snappy dresser!

Fantastic TA. Had him for 101 and then his practice quizzes and tests helped me throughout 202. Crystal clear explanations and will always sit down with you, clarifying the difficult in a variety of ways so that it makes perfect sense. Thanks Teo :)
Teo is such a helpful TA. All of my friends in other tutorial sessions came to mine because he made his own practice exams and gave feedback with such detail. Thanks a lot Teo!
Most helpful TA Ive ever had! He gives fantastic feedback and takes time to make sure you understand before moving on.

Out of all the professors or TAs Ive had, Teo is hands down the best. During tutorial sessions, he reexplains the difficult and pinpoints the important. He holds his own review sessions which SAVED MY GRADE. He truly cares about all his students (grades & well-being) and Id take any course with him again!

She is unorganized, and lecture heavy. Eunice doesn't try to explain topics, just reads directly off her slides(posts them 1 day or 2 after lecture). The written test format and answers require too many details to possibly remember. 2 midterms(noncumulative) and a cumulative final. Your bio 12 grade isn't even relevant to what grade to expect.

She's not good!! For the lab final, she told students to study out of the lab manual and know the SLO and challenge questions. The exam is nothing like what she tells you to study! Also her exams are straight off lecture slides! If u miss a word off slide in your answer, you will get marks taken off. Overall, bad experience! Avoid her if u can

The worst prof I have had so far at SFU. Lectures very heavy and prof was very unclear about midterms and finals; wouldn't specify what was on.  Read off lecture slides every class and would say everythings on the final/midterm. Just not a good prof overall

So many passive aggressive emails sent out to the class. Very tough grader- marks exactly from lecture slides, so if you're missing one bold word you lose a mark even if you had the right idea, marks taken off for spelling words wrong (even ones unrelated to the subject in any way).
she's very unclear about expectations for finals and midterms

Sends 2-4 passive aggressive emails a week scolding students for "rumours". Gives no feedback with grades (only know midterm marks before going into final). Focuses on very small details and marks incredibly hard. Tells you to focus on things then doesn't put them on the exam. Completely ruined my passion and love for biology. Avoid at all costs!!!

Lectures were spent typing as fast as possible to try and get all the notes down while she rushed through them, reading everything off of the slides. Slides were only posted after lecture, so no pre-reading could be done. Labs were horribly structured. Exams were fair, but toughly marked. I'd recommend taking this course with a different professor.
Avoid this class at all costs. worse prof ever, tested hard all written and lectures are really boring.

Honestly, If you enjoy biology and are passionate about it, do not take bisc 101 with Eunice. She made everything so boring, her 2 hour lectures were so dry they seemed like they lasted days. Midterms were alright, final was hell. Do not take with this prof.

Professor Eunice Chin has a good heart but is a terrible Professor when it comes to BISC 101. She  taught a 100 level course like a 300 level course and read everything off her lecture slides. If your still deciding whether to make your major or minor biology, do not take Eunice chin for a prof because she will Make you hate biology
Wouldn't take this professor unless you are a genius at memorzation. Have to be VERY specific on tests otherwise you lose many marks even though you have the main idea. I would not recommend.

talked very fast, hard to understand. went through slides fast before I could copy anything down. refused to post the lecture slides beforehand bc it'd cause ppl "skip more". exams focused on random tiny details covered in 1 sentence on slides instead of main concepts. very memorization heavy. but he did like to scale up to 63% avg which helped.

Not approachable at all. Speaks super fast in his lectures. I took this class again with a different prof and my mark went up expedentionally. Avoid taking class with him at all costs. Tried to go into his office hours to see where I went wrong, and it was pretty much because I didn't use his words word for word in the exam.

He taught awfully, I fall behind a lot and couldn't really catch up on time, due to the massive amount of memorization. In overall he was so nice and kind but his teaching was only reading off the slides which I can do it myself.

He is an alright prof, not very engaging but his exams were extremely fair. He does do extra point questions he will mention only in the lecture. The exams were straight off the slides so you don't really need the textbook. I studied the night before for every exam and did totally fine. Please just study the slides with a friend or something.

Lecture slides are the only thing testable which is good, but you need to know everything word for word for the midterms/exams which is insanely difficult when studying. Don't buy the textbook! Didn't use it once! Lectures were mostly dry but he cracked some jokes here and there which were funny.

The exams were bearable for me, but I completely agree with what others said about memorizing word for word, and that the bigger concepts were completely avoided n instead I'm asked about what the actual freak a goiter is. Went to his office hours once and he told me to look in the textbook to find the answer to my question. AVOID AT ALL COSTS PLS
only written tests with questions focusing on points barely touched upon in the lecture
Tony was OK for BISC101, his exams are pretty tough and he expects a lot of memorization.

Not the worst prof I've had, but also not the best. The lectures were so pointless and boring. On his tests you have to copy word for word what his ppt slides say in order to get full marks. The tests weren't too bad but he is a hard marker. We didn't even use the textbook at all so don't buy it.

I hated coming to his class, made every lecture boring. His tests are ridiculous. Had to memorize his slides word for word and Ta's marked those test like their lives were on the line. If you have photographic memory youd ace this class. Tony is also unapproachable during class. Gives attitude whenever you ask a question.

Honestly most of these reviews are pretty harsh but overall the class was not bad you just have to be willing to put in the work and study, he makes it really clear that his exams are from the slides so literally just study that and you will do really well in the course, going to lectures is a waste of time, just listen to the recordings

Half of the lectures were a waste of time. Tony does not prep you for the exams. He says the test is based on the powerpoint and it is....but only the minor things. On the final there were questions based on topics we barely discussed in class. Textbook was not used so don't buy it. DON'T TAKE THIS CLASS WITH HIM!!!

Tony Williams's lectures are boring, and half of the content isn't even on the exams. The midterm had the highest average he ever had at 63%, and so he decided to make the second midterm and final extremely difficult and on random insignificant topics from his lectures and slides. if possible: Avoid

Williams is pretty decently civil, and the material he teaches is not too bad. But his tests were traumatic; no/limited MC, fill-in-the blank questions were quite vague, and you MUST memorize his powerpoints to do well overall. If memorization is your strong suit, you can manage. If you can avoid taking 101 with him, I recommend doing so.

Midterms and the Final exam were extremely poorly created with mistakes DURING THE EXAM. Lectures were optional as the exams were based on PowerPoint slides, but questions during the exam were very off-topic and random at times. AVOID HIM AT ALL COST TO SAVE MENTAL HEALTH
Idk what the big deal is, but this Tony guy teaches a decent class. I didn't go to lectures but I caught the tail-end of one and he seemed like a solid guy.

Tony had so much potential to make this course bearable, but instead he chose to make exams very hard with content that was very unspoken of in the notes. Joked too much about grading us poorly in our exam. Seems that past years he taught this course the reviews are positive not sure what happened this year
his lectures are SO BORING AND POINTLESS, exams had the most out of pocket questions, he is very rude when you ask him questions AVOID AVOID
exams were a joke, he asked the most random questions that he never talked about in lectures just do youself a favour and never take a class with him

Has the most boring lectures, makes taking notes difficult as he goes through slides extremely fast, doesnt explain things well. Also does not like to see his class do well, told us that the class average was too high (it was below 60) and then decided to make the next exam harder to drop everyone

Easy one of the worst profs I have had. Do not take this class with him. Super rude, does not care about students. Literally was so rude to my friend for appealing a marking mistake that he made... claiming that he was being super generous with her for giving her the correct marks. Like hello? Horrible.

This guy literally has no idea what hes teaching even though hes the chair of biology, he would tell us in class that things he taught previously were actually wrong and that we have to figure them out ourselves for the exams, and for the final he made it purposely hard because the class average was the highest he's ever had at 63%.

I really had a bad time during BISC 101 this semester. Tony was very unhelpful and really seemed like he wanted us to fail. His lectures were not useful, it was just him speaking off the slides and providing no important information. His exams often had wrong information, unclear instructions and just a terrible format.

Very bad teacher. Expects you to know word for word every single slide (even though he says he wants you to understand it). Better to memorize. He does fill in the blank questions which make no sense so be prepared to memorize. Gives attitude when you ask questions about why you got marks off on an exam.

Mr. Williams is a passionate professor at SFU. His knowledge of Biology as a whole is fantastic! Some cautions would be the way he grades exams. If you do not use the EXACT wording from his slides and lectures, you will get the question wrong even if you answer the question correctly. Make sure you show up to every lecture!
Terrible prof too lecture heavy very strict and decided class avg was too high so he made everything harder.

This man legit hates answering students' questions. Since the class was online, he made the questions a bit more difficult. He hates high averages so he made the second midterm way harder and the final was just a joke. I say if he outlines something or hints something its going to be on the final and answer questions on the slides that have no answ

Initially I felt prof Williams was a laid back and had a fun sense of humour. He seems like a nice guy but as a prof he is rather sub par. I found when preparing for his midterms and finals that his lecture slides were rather messy. Like mentioned already, he made the second midterm significantly harder than the first one, hoping to lower the avg.

thought he was ok until the mt. average for the 1st one was high and he didn't like that, so he made the 2nd one AND the final unreasonably hard. topics were pulled off his slides and you need to know them word for word, even a small spelling mistake for the short ans makes it wrong. exams also had some things we didn't even learn

Tony is a really nice professor. He cares about his students a lot. The tests are manageable as long as you are on top of everything. Most of the test questions are straight from the ppts so memorize the ppts. His TA Ahmed was the best. He helped a lot and made everything 10 times easier and more fun. Be on top of everything and you will be fine.

First midterm avg being high made him angry so he made 2nd midterm and final hard asf. People say to just memorize his slidestrust me its a lot easier said then done lol. Study hard and understand cuz even control F wont save you.

Terrible prof terrible person, doesnt accommodate to anyones situation and problems they may have outside of class. First MT he made doable therefore avg was around 75 however soon as he realized students arent failing he made 2 MT hard to ensure grades dropped. Doesnt teach well and exams are exactly as seen on slides so have to memorize tons

Doesnt explain concepts well so I suggest reading the textbook for confusing parts. For his exams you need to memorize hundreds of detailed slides word for word and understand it well. There is short answer questions you must write it exactly how hes worded it + correct spelling. He doesnt give enough time. Very hard class avg was C+. Good luck.

Doesnt accommodate to students situations and is extremely reliant on exam marks. Good thing is the exams are based directly off lecture notes so if you can memorize hundreds of slides you might have a chance of doing well on the tests.

At first, I thought this class would be amazing. It ended up being terrible because of the exams. He needs us to memorize every single slide word for word. Spelling mistakes and tiny mistakes can cause marks to be taken off as well.

Tony's tests are based on the slides. He expects you to know the information from the slides very well and on the test, the answers should be answered very similar to slides which makes him a strict marker. The material was interesting but it might not be easy to learn them just from the slides so the textbook comes in handy.

This professor makes you memorize his slides word for word, or you will not get marks on his exam. He made the second midterm much more difficult because he believed a portion of the class was cheating. A couple questions were on the second midterm even though he explicitly said they would not be.

My class was online and this meant that without a doubt there would be academic dishonesty to a certain extent. This meant the average was higher than usual on the first MT. His solution? in his own words, make the second midterm so hard you wouldn't do well even if you cheated. Top-tier solution. The second midterm average was quite low.
